The grant of Bilsdale then was made iourteen years later than that of Griff and Tilston3 and, consequently, inasmuch as Walter Espec's charter, described as the Foundation Charter‚ is as carefully and definitely precise in delineating the boundaries of north-east Bilsdale as it is in marking out those of Griff and Tilston, there can be no question that as a formal and authoritative conveyance of the former, as well as of the latter, it must, at the most, be con- temporaneous with the grant of Bilsdale in 1145.
